parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Radio and Chat

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Sounds

</value></part><part><name>gr3</name>=<value> Custom Radio and Chat

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sends the message to the custom radio channel. The message is defined in the [[description.ext]] file or radio protocol.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''customRadio''' [customChannelID, message]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> customChannelID: [[Number]] - [[Channel IDs|custom channel ID]] returned by [[radioChannelCreate]] command

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> message: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[customRadio]] [1, "WordEnemy"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[radioChannelCreate]], [[customChat]], [[sideRadio]], [[groupRadio]], [[vehicleRadio]], [[globalRadio]], [[directSay]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 3, 2016 - 21:35 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To transmit user custom sounds (see [[Multiplayer_Custom_Sounds_Tutorial]]), prefix the full filename including file extension with #. For example if there is a custom user sound file called <tt>MySound.ogg</tt>, to play it on the radio use:
<code>[[player]] [[customRadio]] [1, "#MySound.ogg"];</code> 
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
